claim: The superhero with the maximum attribute value is a Kryptonian.
extra_info: maximum attribute value refers to MAX(attribute_value);
reasoning: The maximum attribute_value is 100, but it is shared by many superheroes of various races (Human, Mutant, God/Eternal, Android, Cosmic Entity, Kryptonian, etc.), not uniquely held by a Kryptonian. While some Kryptonians do have the max value, so do many non-Kryptonians, so the claim that 'the superhero with the maximum attribute value is a Kryptonian' is contradicted.

content.thinking: Let me explore the database schema and then verify the claim.

input.description: List all tables in the database

content.content:
alignment       colour          hero_attribute  publisher       superhero     
attribute       gender          hero_power      race            superpower

tool_use_result.stdout:
alignment       colour          hero_attribute  publisher       superhero     
attribute       gender          hero_power      race            superpower

content.content:
CREATE TABLE alignment
(
    id        INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    alignment TEXT default NULL
);
CREATE TABLE attribute
(
    id             INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    attribute_name TEXT default NULL
);
CREATE TABLE colour
(
    id     INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    colour TEXT default NULL
);
CREATE TABLE gender
(
    id     INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    gender TEXT default NULL
);
CREATE TABLE publisher
(
    id             INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    publisher_name TEXT default NULL
);
CREATE TABLE race
(
    id   INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    race TEXT default NULL
);
CREATE TABLE superhero
(
    id             INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    superhero_name TEXT default NULL,
    full_name      TEXT default NULL,
    gender_id      INTEGER          default NULL,
    eye_colour_id  INTEGER          default NULL,
    hair_colour_id INTEGER          default NULL,
    skin_colour_id INTEGER          default NULL,
    race_id        INTEGER          default NULL,
    publisher_id   INTEGER          default NULL,
    alignment_id   INTEGER          default NULL,
    height_cm      INTEGER          default NULL,
    weight_kg      INTEGER          default NULL,
    foreign key (alignment_id) references alignment(id),
    foreign key (eye_colour_id) references colour(id),
    foreign key (gender_id) references gender(id),
    foreign key (hair_colour_id) references colour(id),
    foreign key (publisher_id) references publisher(id),
    foreign key (race_id) references race(id),
    foreign key (skin_colour_id) references colour(id)
);
CREATE TABLE hero_attribute
(
    hero_id         INTEGER default NULL,
    attribute_id    INTEGER default NULL,
    attribute_value INTEGER default NULL,
    foreign key (attribute_id) references attribute(id),
    foreign key (hero_id) references superhero(id)
);
CREATE TABLE superpower
(
    id         INTEGER not null
            primary key,
    power_name TEXT default NULL
);
CREATE TABLE hero_power
(
    hero_id  INTEGER default NULL,
    power_id INTEGER default NULL,
    foreign key (hero_id) references superhero(id),
    foreign key (power_id) references superpower(id)
);

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claude-code-claimdb/test_dbs/superhero.sqlite" "SELECT s.superhero_name, r.race, ha.attribute_value FROM hero_attribute ha JOIN superhero s ON ha.hero_id = s.id LEFT JOIN race r ON s.race_id = r.id WHERE ha.attribute_value = (SELECT MAX(attribute_value) FROM hero_attribute);"
input.description: Find superhero(es) with max attribute value and their race

content.text:
The maximum attribute value is 100, and there are **many** superheroes with this maximum value. The claim says "**the** superhero with the maximum attribute value is a Kryptonian" — implying there is a single superhero. While some Kryptonians (Superman, Supergirl, Superboy-Prime, Power Girl, General Zod, Krypto) do have the max attribute value of 100, so do many non-Kryptonian heroes (Batman, Spider-Man, Thor, Hulk, etc.).

The claim states "**the** superhero" (singular/definite), suggesting one unique superhero has the maximum attribute value. In reality, many superheroes share this maximum, and they come from many different races — not just Kryptonian. The claim is therefore not supported by the data.

```json
{"label": "CONTRADICTED", "reasoning": "The maximum attribute_value is 100, but it is shared by many superheroes of various races (Human, Mutant, God/Eternal, Android, Cosmic Entity, Kryptonian, etc.), not uniquely held by a Kryptonian. While some Kryptonians do have the max value, so do many non-Kryptonians, so the claim that 'the superhero with the maximum attribute value is a Kryptonian' is contradicted."}
```
